forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy, with a low around 52. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Areas Of Fog
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain and patchy fog before 9am, then areas of fog and a chance of rain between 9am and 10am, then areas of fog and a slight chance of drizzle between 10am and 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 1 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city is shrouded in a gentle veil of fog, enveloping the familiar skyline in a soft, gray mist. The air is cool, hinting at the promise of rain as a slight breeze rustles through the streets. Clouds hang low, suggesting a day more suited for introspection than outdoor revelry, with the temperature hovering in the low fifties and whisperings of a pattering rain anticipated.

Throughout the morning, the fog lingers, occasionally giving way to fleeting glimpses of the iconic Golden Gate, blurring the boundaries between land and sky. The forecast predicts these murky conditions will persist, with only the faintest chance of drizzle accompanying a primarily overcast sky. Dressing in layers will be advisable; a warm, comfortable sweater paired with a light raincoat would suit the day's temperament. This urban landscape, soaked in cool hues and the promise of rain, offers an invitation to explore the quieter corners of the city. A stroll through one of the museums might provide snug refuge or perhaps a café visit where one can sip a warming brew, watching the world drift by, as the streets quietly embrace the ethereal charm of a foggy San Francisco morning.
